overview:
Alexander Stoeckel joined b-to-v Partners AG in 2007. He studied International Management at the European Business School (ebs) and the International School of Management (ISM) and holds an MBA from the University of Oxford. Prior to b-to-v, he worked as fund-of-fund manager for Hauck&Aufhaeuser Privatbankiers and as Executive Managing Assistant for KPMG.

Alexander works as an Investment Manager at b-to-v. His regular tasks involve the screening and evaluation of business concepts, the coordination of the investment process, including drafting of term sheets, negotiation, and finalization, due diligence, supervision of legal process, signing and closing, reporting, and exit management.

He coaches the management teams of existing portfolio companies and he is part of the team that overseas the management and administration of bâ€toâ€vâ€™s side funds.

Last but not least, Alexander acts as guest lecturer for Entrepreneurial Finance courses (regarding start-up financing) hosted at the universities of Friedrichshafen (Germany), Liechtenstein (Liechtenstein), Bern, and Basel, St.Gallen (Switzerland).

degrees.subject: International Business & Administration
degrees.institution: University of Oxford / SAID Business School
